intro: Saussurea papposa, commonly known as the silky saffron or goatweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, including parts of China, Mongolia, and Russia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and often hairy foliage. The plant is distinguished by its finely haired stems and leaves, as well as its yellow to orange composite flowers that bloom in late summer. Saussurea papposa is typically found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, thriving in cool, arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional herbal medicine.
